description.narrative:
Samarbetet är ett 3-årigt stöd för att förbättra Albaniens kemikaliehantering, vilket genomförs av den svenska Kemikalieinspektionen tillsammans med ministeriet för turism och miljö samt andra albanska intressenter. Projektets fokus ligger på närmande av landets lagstiftning till EU-direktiv samt stärkt kompetens och institutionell kapacitet att tillämpa ny lagstiftning och närma sig EU-standarder för en säker kemikaliehantering. Projektet omfattar kemikalier såväl som biocider och växtskyddsmedel och kommer att involvera flera ministerier och institutioner men där ministeriet för turism och miljö är samordnande.
Ett urval av förväntade projektresultat: 1.1 Albansk lagstiftning anpassad till EUs lagar. 2.1 En framtagen plan för institutionell kapacitetsutveckling som är förankrad av relevanta stakeholders/aktörer. 2.2 Ett etablerat kemikaliekontor. 2.4 Relevant personal har ökad kompetens för tillämpning av EUs kemikalielagstiftning. 2.6 En kemikaliehelpdesk etablerad och i funktion. 2.7 Industrin förberedd att genomföra krav i enlighet med EU-lagstiftningen. 3.1 En rapport/studie om införande av nationellt kemikalieregister med rekommendationer för fortsatt arbete. 3.3 Ett funktionellt kemikalieregister.

The cooperation is a three year project support, 2018-2021, to improve Albania's chemicals management implemented by the Swedish Chemicals Agency together with the ministry for tourism and environment and other Albanian stakeholders. The project focus is on aligning Albania's legislation with the EU Acquis and increasing the capacity of the administration to implement the new legislation and get closer to EU-standards for safe chemicals management. The project will encompass work on chemicals, biocides and plant protection products and will involve project staff from several ministries and institutions with the Ministry of Tourism and Environment being the lead institution.
Selected expected outcomes: 1.1 National legislation is further aligned with the EU legislation. 2.1 A plan supporting the institutional capacity building is in place and accepted by relevant stakeholders. 2.2 An established and operational chemicals office. 2.4 Relevant staff are prepared competent authorities tasks under EU chemicals legislation. 2.6 Helpdesk established and in operation. 2.7 Industry prepares for complying with obligations in EU chemicals legislation. 3.1 A report on the chemicals registry outlining the results that can serve as a basis for future work. 3.3 A functioning chemicals registry.

The overall objective is to create conditions, in the area of chemical legislation, for membership in the EU. The project objective is to have contributed to the effective implementation of the EU acquis on chemicals, biocidal products and PPP (plant protection) at the accession. Selected expected outcomes: 1.1 National legislation is further aligned with the EU legislation. 2.1 A plan supporting the institutional capacity building is in place and accepted by relevant stakeholders. 2.2 An established and operational chemicals office. 2.4 Relevant staff are prepared competent authorities tasks under EU chemicals legislation. 2.6 Helpdesk established and in operation. 2.7 Industry prepares for complying with obligations in EU chemicals legislation. 3.1 A report on the chemicals registry outlining the results that can serve as a basis for future work. 3.3 A functioning chemicals registry.

tag.narrative: 12.4 - By 2020, achieve the environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with agreed international frameworks, and significantly reduce their release to air, water and soil in order to minimize their adverse impacts on human health and the environment.

12.4 - Senast 2020 uppnå miljövänlig hantering av kemikalier och alla typer av avfall under hela deras livscykel, i enlighet med överenskomna internationella ramverket, samt avsevärt minska utsläppen av dem i luft, vatten och mark i syfte att minimera deras negativa konsekvenser för människors hälsa och miljön.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: 1. National legislation: The project earlier supported the SANE27 gap analysis and development of needs in regards to chemicals management/legislation. During 2020 development of secondary legislation (Decions of Council of Ministers, DCM) related to biocidal products, asbestos, mercury etc were supported. 2. Instititional capacity development: a. The project has supported the establisment of the new chemicals office (as stipulated by the Chemicals management law) in the National Environmental Agency, NEA. Swedish experts provided information, ideas etc on the role and functioning of such an office, its instititutional place, capacities needed etc. The office has three staff currently and holds regular meetings (every week/fortnight) with the project team. b. The establishment of an inter-sectoral chemical safety committee is foreseen in the Law on chemicals management. The committee shall act as an advisory forum for policy coordination and decision-making and exchange of information, without mandate for binding decision-making. Experts from the project has supported the drafting of the functions, composition, and rules and procedures of the committee (the final provisions shall be decided by an order of the Prime Minister). c. The development of a national five-year plan on the safe management of chemicals is ongoing. It has taken quite some time to organize the participation of the administrative staff from the different ministries and institutions.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
